channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump vows to appeal felony conviction
item.description: Donald Trump on Friday railed against his historic guilty verdict in the New York criminal hush money trial and vowed to appeal his conviction in remarks that were filled with false claims.

item.title: UVA to pay $9 million related to shooting that killed 3 football players, wounded 2 students
item.description: The University of Virginia will pay $9 million in a settlement related to a 2022 campus shooting that killed three football players and wounded two students

item.title: Tesla shareholder sues Musk for alleged $7.5 billion insider trading
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 5/31: CBS Evening News
item.description: Biden rebukes Trump's response to New York conviction; School official helps veteran fulfill dying wish to receive high school diploma

item.title: Donald Trump found guilty of all 34 charges in hush money trial
item.description: A Manhattan jury found Donald Trump guilty on all 34 counts of falsifying business records he faced in his New York hush money criminal trial.

item.title: Now that Donald Trump has been convicted, what happens next?
item.description: Former President Donald Trump being found guilty of 34 counts will not stop him from being able to run for election in November -- and the case is not over yet.

item.title: Northern lights could be visible in the US again tonight: What states should look to the sky
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Muted frenzy in the courtroom when Trump verdict came in
item.description: As the verdict was read, former President Donald Trump's eyes appeared to close, and his head shook slightly, lips pursed and eyes downcast.

item.title: May 30, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The war in Gaza will likely continue until at least the end of the year, an Israeli official warned.

item.title: WATCH: Rehabilitated koala released back into wild
item.description: A rehabilitated koala that was injured in a car collision was released back into the wild, surrounded by a contingent of police officers to see the marsupial off.

item.title: Major US airlines will not commit to boosting military travel benefits, USDOT says
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Breaking down Biden's comments on Trump, Middle East
item.description: President Biden broke his silence Friday on former President Donald Trump's conviction in his New York criminal case. His comments preceded remarks about a new Israeli cease-fire proposal. Margaret Brennan and Major Garrett have analysis.

item.title: May 29, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: The Israeli military says it established "operational control" over the Philadelphi Corridor, a 14-kilometer (8.7 miles) strip of land along the border between Gaza and Egypt.

item.title: Canadian serial killer Robert Pickton, who brought victims to pig farm, is dead after prison assault
item.description: Canadian serial killer Robert Pickton, who took female victims to his pig farm during a crime spree near Vancouver in the late 1990s and early 2000s, has died after being assaulted in prison

item.title: Man sentenced for forging Purdue professors' signatures to change his grades
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Trump says "we're going to fight" in remarks a day after his conviction
item.description: Former President Donald Trump was found guilty on 34 felony counts in a case stemming from a "hush money" payment to adult film star Stormy Daniels.

item.title: First day of jury deliberations in Trump New York hush money trial
item.description: The jury in Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial has been dismissed for the day after deliberating for more than four hours on Wednesday.

item.title: Gas line cut 6 minutes before deadly explosion in Youngstown, Ohio: NTSB
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board sent a team of pipeline and hazardous materials investigators to Youngstown, Ohio, to investigate the natural gas explosion.

item.title: New Jersey attorney general blames shore town for having too few police on boardwalk during melee
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Biden rebukes Trump's response to New York conviction
item.description: Speaking from the White House on Friday, President Biden criticized former President Donald Trump's response to his conviction in New York. Trump has claimed the trial was "unfair" and "rigged." Robert Costa has more.
